Title: Remembrance Day disrupted as protesters jeer Chinese national anthem
Summary: Protesters see opportunity to get their message to the world but others question whether it was right thing to do at sombre memorial event

Title: Hong Kong protesters stage flash-mob demonstrations as unrest enters sixth month
Summary: Sunday’s mayhem – including ‘shopping tours’, trashed train stations and shops, tear gas and water cannons – follows peaceful mourning over death of student Chow Tsz-lok, with calls for another citywide strike on Monday.

Title: Saturday forum to discuss ways to help Hong Kong heal
Summary: Local and overseas speakers discuss ways to encourage dialogue, reconciliation.

Title: Chinese media from 30 countries condemn attack on Xinhua in Hong Kong
Summary: Group led by International Daily News, which has links to Chinese state media, issues joint statement decrying ‘barbaric acts of the mob against the national news agency’.

Title: HKUST classes suspended on Monday as campus recovers from vandalism
Summary: University issues statement saying it is deeply saddened to see turmoil spread to city’s higher education institutions and also condemns ‘malicious’ attack of mainland Chinese student who was beaten up during forum on Wednesday.

Title: Beijing ‘should give more details on Hong Kong national security plans’
Summary: After a recent party plenum, Beijing called for stronger safeguards of national security. But former legislature president says leaders will need to elaborate on how they intend to bring them in.

Title: The Hong Kong protesters giving Singles’ Day a miss
Summary: The e-commerce bonanza has become an international phenomenon, with US$30 billion of goods sold last year. But some shoppers in the city are shunning mainland Chinese businesses, no matter how big the discounts.

Title: As it happened: protesters return to Tseung Kwan O car park after citywide flash mobs
Summary: After a relatively peaceful Saturday, black-clad protesters are out on the streets again, with some holding demonstrations in shopping malls.

Title: Emergency services turn on each other at Hong Kong protest
Summary: Police and fire departments release second joint statement in a week after tensions boil over again between their staff during a demonstration in Tuen Mun.

Title: Hong Kong police officers said they would ‘celebrate student’s death’
Summary: Riot officers were filmed on Tuen Mun footbridge taunting protesters below, with one heard shouting ‘we are opening a bottle of champagne to celebrate [death of Chow Tsz-lok] tonight’.

Title: Hong Kong police watchdog ‘lacks power’ to probe force conduct during protests
Summary: ‘Light touch’ Independent Police Complaints Council, which is investigating allegations against officers at demonstrations, has ‘shortfall’ in capabilities, expert panel says.

Title: Hong Kong schools less popular with Chinese parents in Shenzhen
Summary: Continuing unrest, anti-mainland sentiment and a long commute for ‘cross-border’ kids behind spike in inquiries to international schools.

Title: Need for national security law in Hong Kong ‘becoming urgent’
Summary: Steps must also be taken to prevent ‘foreign forces’ from interfering in city’s affairs, director of Chinese central government’s Hong Kong and Macau Affairs Office says.

Title: Letters | Protests will rage on until elites start feeling the pinch
Letters | What protesting Hong Kong youth need is not national education
Summary: To prevent future unrest, Hong Kong youth need to be taught media and information literacy, rather than patriotism, so that they are not swayed by fake news.

Title: Letters | Why Hong Kong police would benefit from commission of inquiry
Summary: As professionalism is pushed to its limits, the responsibilities should not fall solely on overwhelmed frontline officers. A commission of inquiry would be a first step to getting them out of the quagmire.

Title: Letters | The NBA stood up to China, it’s time more brands did the same
Letters | Are Hong Kong protesters influencing New York, or vice versa?
Hong Kong teenager has abortion following claim of gang-rape in police station
Summary: Police say investigation does not match with girl’s description of the station and room ‘not matching reality’

Title: Hongkongers hold peaceful vigil for student killed in fall
Summary: Gathering at Tamar Park, and another near the scene of Chow’s injuries, sombre and subdued compared with recent street clashes. But there are still flashes of anger against police, and calls for revenge.

Title: Hong Kong barristers hit back at Beijing’s comments on judiciary
Summary: Vice-Premier Han Zheng said ending months of violence was the ‘common responsibility of the city’s executive, legislative and judicial bodies’. But the Bar Association says exhorting judges to help the government could be seen as a threat to their independence.

Title: Pro-government supporters in Hong Kong slam ‘cowardly’ vigilante attacks
Summary: In first briefing of its kind, styled on protest movement’s own ‘citizens’ press conference’, a former police officer reveals how his daughter was targeted while others call for city to return to peace.

Title: As it happened: thousands gather for rally to mourn death of student
Summary: Chow Tsz-lok, an undergraduate at the Hong Kong University of Science and Technology, reportedly fell from a car park in Tseung Kwan O in the early hours of Monday near police operations, later dying from brain injuries.

Title: Hong Kong protests: 10 top reads as city marks 5 months of unrest
Summary: It started with a peaceful march. It has turned into months of social unrest, violence, hatred in society, a beleaguered government and police force and no end in sight

Title: Attack on TVB cameraman by protesters condemned by media groups
Summary: Broadcaster’s employee was covering incident in Mong Kok when he was set upon by protesters, while media outlet HK01 was also targeted, with company vehicle smashed in Tseung Kwan O.

Title: Mainland Chinese students flee Hong Kong fearing they will be attacked next
Summary: Exodus of Hong Kong University of Science and Technology students follows violent reaction from protesters to death of undergraduate Chow Tsz-lok.

Title: Hong Kong lawmaker arrests ‘paving the way’ for election cancellation
Summary: Opposition camp slams ‘mass arrest’ of seven of its lawmakers on the same night city mourned the death of student from injuries sustained during a police operation. But minister for mainland affairs says there is no link with district council elections.

Title: A new Steam game lets you fight as a Hong Kong protester
Summary: Liberate Hong Kong was inspired by Blizzard’s Blitzchung controversy, and now it’s making Steam the next battleground for protesters
